p: Malaria is a serious and life threatening disease caused by Plasmodium parasites that are transmitted to humans through the bites of infected Anopheles mosquitoes [ 67] . Generally, malaria is treated with the prescription drugs. However, Sulistyaningsih etÂ al., (2017) demonstrated the antimalarial activity of the methanolic extract of Leea indica leaves in malaria-induced mice model [ 68]. This result may give an indication that other species of Leea genus could have antimalarial potentials.
